text:
The upward-sloping segment of the LRATC curve indicates that diseconomies of scale
are present. Diseconomies of scale may result as the increasing bureaucracy of larger
firms leads to inefficiency, problems with motivating a larger workforce, and greater
barriers to innovation and entrepreneurial activity. A firm operating under diseconomies
of scale will want to decrease output and move back toward the minimum efficient scale.
The U.S. auto industry is an example of an industry that has exhibited diseconomies of
scale.
